document.title: EMPIRE STATE INFORMATION FLUENCY CONTINUUM Priority Skills: Grades 3-5

30C57EBAB3594B08B31C7BBF661EB0CA.description: Exhibits effective skills in sharing knowledge gained through personal and academic pursuits

241B0A9CB0054E4A8A7459D7CD5C786E.description: Recognizes multiple facets of own personal identity

FF87E35AB116408D8FB24DAB7291F753.description: Displays self-confidence in forming and sharing own opinion and ideas

404BCD7EAC004814ADB7613E5B84B29E.description: Information-fluent learners develop agency (personal identity and confidence) to express their ideas, raise awareness, advocate for change, and/or take social action.

B496E81340F044F0A19034E32CB786DC.description: Reflects on own social and emotional strengths and challenges [self-awareness]

E30C304CD0C742D682200F8CDE6803B0.description: Sets reading and learning goals and perseveres to achieve those goals [self-management]

B53E1EAA2A7A4274ADB6F2A8B2759609.description: Identifies and respects cultural differences and diverse opinions [social awareness]

023D265FDD1B45859D80F7B13C7F4F7E.description: Forms positive relationships with peers [relationship skills]

71346EE015E34B48AC3BACCD14E93E8C.description: Identifies and empathizes with the perspectives of others [social awareness]

5D7D628FCE7448FE9A18C691C5686F26.description: Follows personal and academic interests to pursue in-depth inquiries and build deep knowledge

219FF78B95154E13BAD74F3DD5076D04.description: Identifies favorite authors, genres, and topics and explores them on own

9C53F800B63F4EF7999142A35FB32542.description: Demonstrates motivation to read and learn on own

D3A003779C7A42689CF7CB64D82ACFC8.description: Personal Exploration and Independent Reading and Learning

CF2F286C79F045F881F99FE66DCE9D40.description: Information-fluent learners use information and ideas presented in any format to reflect on and pursue personal interests, develop strengths, and engage in personalized and independent learning.

7A902E99EAB54798859A8AB81E725F35.description: Personal Growth and Agency: Engage in Personal Exploration, Social and Emotional Growth, Independent Reading and Learning, and Personal Agency

AFE87A0CE5CD4BC1B0455C374F74261E.description:
Engages in positive online behavior by dealing with cyberbullying, recognizing and avoiding stereotypes, and selecting appropriate sites
only

E5D5F5DA60464BD8AF859D0BE0FD2CCA.description: Demonstrates basic netiquette behavior by interacting respectfully with others and contributing to a positive online community

813A85B8117349BB8C85C7AEE30F8EF2.description: Demonstrates basic cybersafety (strong passwords, privacy, accessing appropriate sites)

473FE54B6BC34963B826428EE0559D7D.description: Safe and Ethical Use of Technology

B218B54A60334E3EB1D96C6FD6E90165.description: Uses strategies to avoid plagiarizing by summarizing, paraphrasing, quoting, and crediting the information used

604D6EDE43654E5580C358612C4BE070.description: Information-fluent learners demonstrate digital citizenship by maintaining ethical decision making and behavior and avoiding the spread of misinformation in the exchange and use of information.

C884E7B4D1AE4C35899BBCA988AAE259.description: Actively solicits and listens with an open mind to the opinions and ideas of others

A8136790FB9C4509A1A13F218E1716B3.description: Works with a group to do research, share results and resources, discuss issues, make decisions, and create learning products

97691AC395034500B6800E1B730B36EC.description: Information-fluent learners demonstrate effective collaboration in the exchange of information, in both the face-to-face and digital environment.

5DBCB7383FB34B35B0C3496518986655.description: Recognizes the right to express own opinion in an appropriate manner, even when the opinion differs from the ideas of others

4A0F27199EB149F28C3125FE9EBFA2B6.description: Engages in conversations with peers to exchange ideas and information about social and civic issues

C4D460EA9C6D41F7821B3F9C6FBC962C.description:
Identifies and challenges own assumptions about community issues and diverse cultures by seeking and considering multiple viewpoints
and cultural perspectives

B4BF031DDA084614AD40A4847CC0BBD6.description: Verifies information that is presented as “the truth”

C84BD2726BFC4202A06FC746846FD780.description: Learning from Diverse and Credible Points of View

C0C1A94D21394B3BAD84362455B6B755.description: Information-fluent learners recognize the importance of accurate information to a democratic society and actively seek, evaluate, learn from, and use credible information from diverse community and global perspectives.

ABC14B4B63774218BDB956CC3F73B2A8.description: Social and Civic Responsibility: Demonstrate Civic Responsibility, Respect for Diverse Perspectives, Collaboration, and Digital Citizenship

2ACDF4F641E7481185FF1553B4899CE7.description:
Creates and delivers presentation with attention to quality of content, effective use of tool, and self-confidence and effectiveness of
delivery

292C6132C232499AB6C5F2F78A14AC05.description: Information-fluent learners present their learning and ideas by constructing messages using multiple, authentic formats appropriate for the purpose and audience.

C13FD4B5EAFF406780372F50690B6706.description: Evaluates the effect of different media elements (e.g., pace, visuals, color) on the overall impact of the media source

E3D331111B134145A9B8511A83CD7FCE.description: Evaluates a media source for accuracy and purpose

02322BB1F87F456C8FDF78A669542DFB.description:
Analyzes information presented visually through illustrations, photographs, diagrams, or maps to determine main ideas and compare to
ideas presented in printed text

809C71056D974A8C97ABCBE934EF54BF.description:
Identifies the author’s or narrator’s point of view and explains how it influences the portrayal of the characters and the sequence of
events in the plot

05FE906DD8A14742803A00E2FBEC8521.description: Uses evidence from stories to discuss characters, setting, plot, time, and place

6E2FDA3B7E4A4513894B6E0601C2760B.description: Explains the meaning of illustrations and what they add to the words of a story

F46E53DFB865484FB4ACB3AAD4AA885C.description: Discusses the main idea or theme of a story

3066E5D404C2494793CA4600BDB7729A.description: Information-fluent learners use multimedia literacy skills and knowledge to deconstruct and learn from texts in multiple formats through comprehension, analysis, interpretation, and evaluation.

0E97E5159F8A43DEAC69BC080B2738BE.description: Multiple Literacies: Use Multiple Literacies to Explore, Learn, and Express Ideas

D5BF4B26B20448A387AFAFD3D72EBC1A.description:
Engages actively in a design process to use tools, resources, and materials to test the hypothesis by creating a solution, assessing the
results, modifying the solution when needed, and determining the validity of the hypothesis

5C64C98DF64C4481A8A6B72D8BA887B6.description:
Engages actively in a design process to use tools, resources, and materials to try the “if. . .then” solutions that seem to have the most
potential, assess the results, and modify the solutions when needed

D2F8BC9F33034486A00E625C5FC2DD7C.description:
Engages actively in a design process to use tools, resources, and materials to try the brainstormed solutions, assess the results, and
modify the solutions when needed

E58F741A1BEA4491BF324B938794F6D9.description: Information-fluent learners experience, experiment, and use a design process to discover creative solutions to authentic problems, form personal understandings, and propose original ideas.

08C4D6CBA63646128F203AEF49CB54F8.description: Identifies own strengths and sets goals for improvement

73D09B035329472794610123E90CC74A.description: Reflects on new understandings, the effectiveness of the product and presentation, and the experience of the process of inquiry

268D405065CB42CCB3BBE6C017C3077B.description: Identifies the important features for a good product and presentation

1DCFD22B37F44C18987C4BD0E4F23F54.description: Provides a bibliography of all sources used according to model provided by teacher

B0CB65C014AC4AD1AE754AB6E3D250F8.description: Modifies and revises own work based on feedback from teacher and peers

A8B4A9A80DCA4FD4B8ABC47A28BD61AF.description: Assesses and revises own work based on teacher-provided criteria

C5543275E0F94B70BAAB58242420852D.description: Presents information clearly so that main points and supporting evidence are readily understood by audience

62FA22FCEF1D4905A0BF80930392E578.description: Presents information clearly so that main points are evident

2AADE3C13D494A98A3FD960391C83058.description: Understands concept of “audience”; determines audience before choosing format and creating product

B520704841DE47368BC261FC938E3F7E.description: Chooses the format for the product based on personal preference or uses format chosen by the teacher or librarian

B62145A08D7940EE834AA406EECC5F2B.description:
Determines the purpose of a presentation (e.g., explanation, claim) and decides how to organize ideas to explain a topic or make a claim
about it

062128E0DF6547458D2C0F3EBF2ABC2B.description: Forms own opinion or claim and uses evidence from texts and clear reasoning to back it up

766F5EC2CC424908BA4B3D2D3AEC2582.description: Draws a conclusion about the main idea with evidence to support that conclusion

523DEC1FC412429289AABADE413E7C74.description: Draws conclusions about research including whether a question was answered or not

E4C44AF0B2D14063B2EE52D26671433B.description: Identifies facts, details, and inferences that support main ideas

FB9568A2E51F4EEFB76B7EF09F5DC3FE.description: States the main idea with some supporting details

58B0C8E5576C442FAB2BA23D1E1D45EC.description: With help, organizes notes and ideas and develops an outline, mind map, or graphic organizer

73268C0669F04066A77CB07C974FD7F8.description: With help, uses common organizational patterns (chronological order, main idea with supporting details) to organize information

0B5FE0D8CE704A268BE02ABFC8D43650.description: Uses various notetaking strategies (e.g., outlining, underlining, bulleted lists, highlighting, graphic organizers) dependent on purpose

ACE6B20F07C544CF8365BAB0F6B955DF.description: Uses a variety of strategies to determine important ideas

DA3659F2A79A42FB9B26302348469474.description: Paraphrases, summarizes information that answers research questions, noting what is fact and what is opinion

0ED94E06CD9E4F01BA40A96384912E1B.description: Making Sense of Information and Notetaking

1CDE8B24611748A29AAB5C5079329263.description: With help, begins to ask questions about the text during reading or listening

0C6318DBEF494134B2F499610BBA2F14.description: Begins to analyze multiple points of view from multiple sources to determine similarities and differences

5220BCF87BA94E358854FC0E4C887A34.description: Begins to understand that different points of view are presented in nonfiction and that nonfiction does not equate to “true”

997DB7B8890140D194E15FB037801633.description: Evaluates information within a source for accuracy, relevance, comprehensiveness, and point of view

54DB2D3D0F274DB79D4C0813CACC6AC2.description:
Makes inferences (with guidance) about the implicit meaning in text to answer research questions and recognizes the difference between
explicit and implicit meaning

98F28A67C0A64FE2A923F5F494350194.description: Selects evidence that explicitly answers the research questions with main ideas and details

FB843CFA7E0444F599C17A05A1A25F9E.description: Uses navigation tools of pre-selected websites and databases to locate relevant information

BB9C85017DCD4FBBB00896C4D5F9BDDD.description: Uses textual and visual elements (title, headings, graphics, photos) to read and comprehend information on websites

E44FC8AC46EC4C2DA8E6CE58853A215C.description: Selects and uses an appropriate print, video, or electronic source to answer questions

5F662B2743DC46E083AC19A8D49FD6D9.description:
Evaluates print, video, and electronic sources (both primary and secondary) for relevance to the topic and credibility of
author/creator/publisher

74C07E93159F483993E584365D6FEC44.description: Uses pre-selected primary sources to gather information; compares primary and secondary sources on the same topic

D6AA588036D548C893D618A1E8B5DF3D.description: With guidance, uses bookmarked websites to find appropriate information

D2D12E87A0D44FC583F32C1C4FCFB5DA.description: Searches the online catalog (author, title, and key words) with assistance to locate materials

AC4F66FF8F094324BB8422080695E40B.description: Identifies and uses the organizational structures of a nonfiction book (table of contents, index, and glossary) to locate information

175F92E523D64147A916015F6E37B8D5.description: Identifies major areas of the library (e.g., Dewey areas; genre areas) and what main topics are included in each

1BC9857375AE4AD49FF970BD0068861D.description: For science topics, forms hypothesis (“if. . .then” statement) that can be “tested” through research or experiment/experience

E36CC43149E8474384DB4A88684A54BD.description: Forms tentative thesis about main ideas with guidance

9D9597B5A8F6411A8B5B934DEA8A9BFD.description:
Begins to assess questions to determine which can be answered by simple facts, which cannot be answered, and which would lead to an
interesting inquiry

04470BBFF8514740A0D6C40681A12840.description: Begins to predict answers to inquiry questions based on background knowledge and beginning observation or experience with help

BFBA0DC8A504463A9913D112B1241C47.description: Formulates questions for investigation of a topic with guidance

254E6C486613457D8C17FD9DF9E9AA84.description: Generates a list of key words for a research-based project with guidance

C1F4B1705E9B4D34931B8ED917BAFE20.description: Uses a source provided by the teacher to acquire background information

C5545970D8DE4DEEBF9A8285ABBF9D32.description: Identifies aspects of the broad topic that would be important and interesting to pursue through inquiry

33BD7A26292E4678B5743952CA24FC59.description:
Information-fluent learners use an inquiry process to connect to prior experience and background knowledge, wonder and ask
questions, investigate, construct new understanding, express learning, and reflect on the process and product of learning.

27FAA381671A44D980F4E54E3A888B86.description: Inquiry and Design Thinking: Use Inquiry and Design Thinking to Build Understanding and Create New Knowledge
